Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in Lafayette Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of Lafayette Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council - (HRC) -- Amend HRC - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Home Rule Charter Amendment)

Summary:  Providing for the replacement of the existing Home Rule Charter and plan of government for the Lafayette City-Parish Consolidated Government.
Race.FullText: Shall the existing Home Rule Charter and plan of government for the Lafayette City-Parish Consolidated Government approved at a public referendum held on November 3, 1992, as heretofore amended, be replaced by (a) Home Rule Charter and plan of government for the City of Lafayette, according to Article VI, Section 4 of the Constitution of Louisiana and other applicable law, and (b) Home Rule Charter and plan of government for the Parish of Lafayette, according to Article VI, Section 5 of the Constitution of Louisiana and other applicable law, both as prepared and submitted by the duly constituted Charter Commission to the Clerk of the Lafayette City-Parish Consolidated Council and to the City-Parish President on April 12, 2011, and shall such separate Charters for the City of Lafayette and for the Parish of Lafayette be adopted?

Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Consolidated School District No. 1)
(Bonds and Millage)

Summary:  To authorize not exceeding $561,000,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation School Bonds of Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafayette for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District as outlined in the current Lafayette Parish Master Facilities Plan with oversight by a Citizen's Oversight Committee and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefore, said bonds to be payable from ad valorem taxes; and to authorize a 20 year, 2 mills tax for the purpose of repairing, maintaining and improving capital school facilities in the District, and providing equipment and furnishings therefore.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Five Hundred Sixty One Million Dollars ($561,000,000) of general obligation bonds to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding nine per centum (9%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring and/or improving lands for building sites and playgrounds, purchasing, erecting and/or improving school buildings and other school related facilities within and for the District as outlined in the current Lafayette Parish Master Facilities Plan with oversight by a Citizen's Oversight Committee and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefore, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with an estimated 23 mills to be levied in the first year of issue to pay said Bonds; and shall said District levy a two (2) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in said District (an estimated $3,260,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2031, for the purpose of repairing, maintaining and improving capital school facilities in the District, and providing equipment and furnishings therefore?
